question: Describe the exploitative relationship that defines colonialism.

answers.text: The relationship is between state societies in which one has political dominance over the other, primarily for economic advantage.
The relationship is between nation-states and the natural environment in which nation-states make self-serving decisions that are bad for the environment.
Because they have been in an area longer, settlers are able to exploit newcomers, including immigrants and refugees.
Because colonialism took place over a long period of time, the relationship between precolonial conditions and postcolonial conditions is definitional.
